properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 3:18AM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...SNOW AND ICE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON INTO EARLY THURSDAY...

.Snow will overspread much of central Illinois Wednesday
afternoon, with a mix of sleet and freezing rain near Interstate
70. Precipitation will continue Wednesday night and into
early Thursday, with snow accumulations of 3 to 4 inches for much
of central Illinois, with isolated 5 inch amounts. The wintry mix
will keep snow totals near 2 inches along a Shelbyville to Paris
line, with ice accumulations around a tenth of an inch near the
I-70 corridor.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
2 o 4 inches north of I-70, with ice accumulations up to a tenth
of an inch near and south of I-70.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Illinois. The
mixture of freezing rain and sleet is most likely near I-70
through this evening, before shifting south around midnight.
Areas north of I-70 will see mostly snow.

* WHEN...Precipitation will move into the area by mid afternoon
and continue into the evening, before slowly diminishing after
midnight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The evening commute
will be impacted, with some lingering slippery conditions for
the Thursday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
